result.execSummary:
The defendant Shadaun A. Marks Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shadaun A. Marks Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shadaun A. Marks Jr. was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay fine of $250.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Don Bielski.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  238 - Matter heard with 13CF306. Case has resolved. DE enters plea of guilty to Ct1 - found guilty by the court. Ct2 dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations made. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 9 months w/conditions concurrent to 13CF306. $2050 fine plus court costs ordered.  No restitution requested.  Firearms warning,  Appeal rights given.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Don Bielski.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1029 - Attys report the officer needed for this motion is on a safety call and is unavailable for this hearing. Adjournment requested - granted.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears with Atty Don Bielski.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  248 - Matter heard with 14CF1345. ST's witnesses have not rec'd paper copies of subpoenas, though subpoenas were continued on the record at the last hearing. As such, ST is not prepared to proceed at this time.  DE takes no position on the matter. Court adjourns. ADA Braun is to notify witnesses and provide proof of such to the court no later than 12/4/15.  Status scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Bielski's investigation is ongoing.  Status conf. to remain on the calendar for 11/24/15 at 2:45.  Bond continued.
Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case trails 13CF306.  Status conf. 10/29/15 at 11:00  and 11/24/15 at 2:45.  Bond continued.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Donald Bielski.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:33am-  Matter heard with 13CF306.  For reasons set forth on the record, Court adjourns matter to October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Donald Bielski.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:01pm-  Matter heard with 13CF306.  Parties jointly requested motion hearing be rescheduled in 13CF306.  Further proceedings adjourned to July 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.
1/7/15 - Preliminary Hearing/Arraignment

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Don Bielski. Clerk LE. Preliminary hearing in 13CF306 and 14CF1345 held together. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Krejcarek. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. KPD Sgt. Matthew Strelow sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Bielski. KPD Officer Brian Miller sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Bielski. Probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Bielski. Tab pulled for Judge Wilk Br. 7. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 2-4-15 @ 1:30pm. Bond continued.
